intro: Kumaria spicata, commonly known as the spike kumaria, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are often used in traditional herbal medicine. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sunlight, making it a hardy perennial in temperate climates. Its aromatic leaves and flowers are also used in culinary applications, adding a subtle, spicy flavor to dishes.
